title: Woman, 25, bashes mother's skull with a crucifix, arrested on a felony assault
text:
A 25-year-old woman is under arrest after repeatedly smashing her mother in the head with a crucifix during a drunken argument, leaving the victim with a fractured skull, police say.

Christian Lydia Martinez, 25, is believed to have been out drinking Sunday afternoon before returning to the family home in San Antonio where she began arguing with her 45-year-old mother, The Smoking Gun reports.

Martinez allegedly removed a 10-inch wooden crucifix from the wall, hitting her mother several times on the head.

The victim was taken to a local hospital for treatment of her injuries.

Christian Lydia Martinez, 25, is accused of smashing her mother in the head with a crucifix. She was arrested on felony aggravated assault, using the cross as a deadly weapon

Martinez fled before police arrived, but was taken into custody later that day, My SanAntonio.com reports.

She was booked on a felony aggravated assault with a deadly weapon charge. She is being held in the Bexar County lockup in lieu of $30,000 bond.
description: Christian Lydia Martinez is charged with a felony assault. Police say Martinez allegedly struck her mother, 45. several times with a crucifix in their San Antonio home,
